Package org.codehaus.preon.buffer

The package providing the abstractions for dealing with data encoded in sequences of bits.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
BitBuffer The interface providing methods reading a given number of bits from the byte buffer and conveting them to the byte, short, int, long (all unsigned) and also to the boolean type values.
 

Class Summary
AbstractBitBufferDecorator An abstract base class for classes wrapping BitBuffers to support additional behavior.
ConcurrentBitBuffer A threadsafe BitBuffer.
DefaultBitBuffer An implementation of BitBuffer wrapping a ByteBuffer.
SlicedBitBuffer A BitBuffer that acts upon a slice of the underyling BitBuffer.
 

Enum Summary
ByteOrder An enumeration, representing byte order.
 

Exception Summary
BitBufferException  
BitBufferUnderflowException  
 

Package org.codehaus.preon.buffer Description

The package providing the abstractions for dealing with data encoded in sequences of bits. The main abstraction to understand is BitBuffer; it is similar to the ByteBuffer interface found in Java NIO, only in this case it acts on the bit level, as opposed to byte level.

Another important abstraction is DefaultBitBuffer. This implementation wraps a ByteBuffer, providing the storage for the bytes accessed through the BitBuffer interface.
